sentence.text: The SNPs rs2124437 (RASGRP3), rs1335022 (protein retention in ER lumen), rs4512367 (PREX2), rs4748011 (CCDC3), and rs1435218 (ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process) were analyzed in 500 histopathologically confirmed oral cancers and 500 healthy controls with a minimum of 10 years of tobacco usage.

A significant association of the SNPs in oral cancer was observed in MAPK cascade AA (rs2124437) (p < 0.000, OR 1.34, 95 % confidence interval (CI) 1.01-1.76), protein retention in ER lumen TT (rs1335022) (p = 0.008, OR 1.58, 95 % CI 1.23-2.03), G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway CC (p = 0.008, OR 1.56, 95 % CI 1.15-2.1), and TT (p < 0.000, OR 2.77, 1.68-4.57) genotypes, whereas the heterozygous genotypes showed higher frequencies in controls, i.e., GRIK2 CT (rs1335022) (p = 0.029, OR 0.68, 95 % CI 0.53-0.87) and PREX2 CT (p = 0.004, OR 0.49, 95 % CI 0.37-0.64), indicating protection.
